name: Acorn
description: A small, oval brown nut with a smooth cap and tapered tip, often found in clusters on oak trees.

name: Chestnut
description: A shiny, mahogany-brown nut encased in a spiky green burr, often found on deciduous forest floors in autumn.

name: Walnut
description: A wrinkled, hard-shelled nut with a ridge down its length and light brown coloration, nestled in a green husk.

name: Hazelnut
description: A round, smooth nut about the size of a marble, tan-brown in color and encased in leafy, husky bracts.

name: Pine Nut
description: A small, elongated ivory seed harvested from pine cones, with a smooth texture and mild resinous aroma.

name: Blackberry
description: A cluster of plump, shiny black-purple berries on thorny vines, often found trailing along the edges of forest paths.

name: Blueberry
description: Small, round berries with a dusty blue-gray color, often found in rippling clusters among green-leafed shrubs.

name: Raspberry
description: Bright red or golden delicate berries growing on thorny bushes, each berry composed of many tiny drupelets.

name: Strawberry
description: Heart-shaped red berries dotted with tiny seeds, nestled close to the forest floor among broad green leaves.

name: Wild Apple
description: A round fruit with mottled red and yellow skin, growing among twisting branches of old wild apple trees.

name: Wild Pear
description: A teardrop-shaped fruit with speckled greenish-yellow skin, hanging from the branches of scraggly pear trees.

name: Elderberry
description: Tiny glossy black berries in umbrella-shaped clusters on reddish stems, often found on the edges of wetlands and forests.

name: Cranberry
description: Small, round red berries with a glossy sheen, often peeking through swampy bog moss and wetland grasses.

name: Lingonberry
description: Bright red berries roughly the size of peas, growing among low evergreen shrubs in cool, mountainous forests.

name: Cloudberry
description: A soft, orange-yellow cluster of drupelets resembling a raspberry, found nestled in boggy mosses of cold highlands.

name: Gooseberry
description: Round green berries often striped or spotted, hanging from thorny bush branches.

name: Chanterelle Mushroom
description: A funnel-shaped mushroom with a bright golden-yellow cap and wavy edges, often found scattered on the forest floor.

name: Morel Mushroom
description: A tall, sponge-like mushroom with a honeycomb-patterned cap of earthy brown, prized among springtime woods.

name: Puffball Mushroom
description: A round, white or tan mushroom that resembles a soft ball of cotton, often puffing out a cloud of spores when disturbed.

name: Oyster Mushroom
description: A cluster of thin, delicate mushrooms with smooth, pale gray to white caps resembling oyster shells, growing on decaying logs.

name: Chicken of the Woods
description: A bright orange and yellow shelf mushroom with overlapping brackets that peel away easily from the log it grows on.

name: Porcini Mushroom
description: A stout mushroom with a thick, creamy-white stalk and a broad brown cap with velvety texture, often found at the base of pine trees.

name: Truffle
description: A round, lumpy knobbly tuber-like fungus with rough dark brown skin, hidden underground among the roots of oak or hazel trees.

name: Enoki Mushroom
description: A cluster of long, thin white mushrooms with tiny caps, often found in dense clumps on dead wood in cooler climates.

name: Glowcap Mushroom
description: A bioluminescent mushroom with a pale cap that glows softly in dark caverns, its underside dotted with tiny luminescent speckles.

name: Crystalcap Mushroom
description: A translucent, crystal-like mushroom that refracts any light into rainbow patterns, found deep in the Underdark.

name: Starlight Mushroom
description: A pale mushroom cap with fine white speckles that resemble stars, often found glowing faintly in subterranean caverns.

name: Dandelion Greens
description: Long, jagged-edged green leaves with a slightly ruffled appearance, often found in open meadows and lawns.

name: Wild Spinach
description: Tender, dark green leaves with a mild flavor, growing in loose rosettes from the ground.

name: Watercress
description: Small vibrant green leaves with a peppery taste, growing in thick mats in slow-moving streams or wetlands.

name: Sorrel
description: Bright green, arrowhead-shaped leaves with a sharp lemony tang, often found in damp meadows.

name: Wild Leek
description: A long green stalk with a white bulb, smelling faintly of onion and garlic, pushing up through forest leaf litter in spring.

name: Cattail Shoot
description: A long, slender spear of pale green, emerging from underwater mats of cattails in marshy areas.

name: Wild Carrot
description: A slender plant with lacy green foliage and a thin, tapered orange root, often found in temperate fields.

name: Parsnip
description: A pale, long root vegetable resembling a carrot but cream-colored, growing in open grassland soils.

name: Lotus Root
description: A long cylindrical root with a series of holes through its center, covered in brown fibrous skin, found buried in muddy pond bottoms.

name: Wild Yam
description: A rough, brown-skinned tuber with a creamy white interior, attached to vines in dense, shaded undergrowth.

name: Ginger Root
description: A knobbly beige root with pale yellow interior flesh, springing from leafy stalks in warm woodland soil.

name: Water Chestnut
description: A flat, round tuber with a dark, leathery skin and crisp white interior, found in muddy bottoms of shallow freshwater.

name: Sunflower Seeds
description: Small grayish-green seeds harvested from the center of a bright yellow sunflower head.

name: Pumpkin Seeds
description: Flat, oval ivory seeds removed from the stringy interior of a large orange pumpkin or squash.

name: Lotus Seeds
description: Round seeds with a translucent greenish coat, encased in round pods above murky waters.

name: Flax Seeds
description: Tiny shiny brown seeds produced in rippled pods on tall flax plants swaying in open fields.

name: Chia Seeds
description: Small black and white speckled seeds from a fuzzy flowering herb found in dry, open terrains.

name: Mustard Seeds
description: Round, hard yellow-brown seeds from a tall flowering plant common in meadows and roadsides.

name: Oyster
description: A rough, irregularly-shaped shell containing a soft, off-white mollusk inside; the shells are often encrusted with barnacles.

name: Clam
description: A smooth, symmetrical shell bivalve, usually creamy white or tan, hiding its soft flesh within sand at tidal flats.

name: Mussel
description: A sleek, oblong black-blue shell that clamps tightly shut, commonly found attached to rocks in intertidal zones.

name: Scallop
description: A fan-shaped shell with radiating ridges, often colorful, housing a round, white muscle inside.

name: Abalone
description: A flattened, ear-shaped shell that is pearlescent inside, clinging to rocks; its meat is beneath the single shell.

name: Sea Snail
description: A spiral or cone-shaped shell often patterned or rough, housing a snail that crawls along rocky shores or tide pools.

name: Kelp
description: Long brown-green fronds with paddle-like blades, often growing in underwater forests off rocky coasts.

name: Nori
description: Thin, paper-like sheets of deep purple-red seaweed that crumble easily, found washed ashore or harvested from tidal zones.

name: Sea Lettuce
description: Thin, bright-green sheets that ripple like banners across tidal stones.

name: Bladderwrack
description: A brown seaweed with branching fronds dotted with tiny round air bladders, floating in tide pools and coastal shallows.

name: Sea Grapes
description: Tiny green bubble-like orbs that grow on trailing seaweed vines, resembling clusters of translucent grapes.

name: Prickly Pear Fruit
description: A fleshy, oval fruit with yellow-orange skin covered in small spines, found atop flat cactus pads.

name: Aloe Leaf
description: A thick triangular succulent leaf containing a translucent gel, green with whitish speckles.

name: Agave Heart
description: The dense, fibrous core of an agave plant with leaf bases peeled back, glistening with sweet sap.

name: Barrel Cactus Fruit
description: A round, bright red fruit perched atop a barrel-shaped cactus with tight ribs.

name: Coconut
description: A large, hard brown shell covered in coarse fibers, containing white flesh and clear liquid inside.

name: Mango
description: A golden-orange oval fruit with smooth skin, dangling from broad-leafed trees in warm groves.

name: Banana
description: A long, curved fruit with yellow peel hiding soft pale flesh, hanging in large clusters.

name: Pineapple
description: A spiky cylindrical fruit with rough diamond-patterned skin and a tuft of green leaves atop its golden body.

name: Dragonfruit
description: A bright pink, oblong fruit with green leaf-like scales dotting its skin, growing on night-blooming cactus.

name: Date
description: An oblong, brownish-red fruit with sweet, chewy flesh, found on tall palms in arid oases.

name: Olive
description: A small oval fruit, green or turning black when ripe, with smooth skin clustered on gnarled evergreen trees.

name: Fig
description: A soft, pear-shaped fruit with mottled purple-green skin and a sweet, seedy interior, hanging from low branches.

name: Mulberry
description: A fruit that starts red and ripens to deep purple-black, growing in clusters on leafy branches.

name: Wild Nettle
description: A tall plant with serrated leaves covered in tiny stinging hairs; leaves appear dark green and jagged.

name: Wild Lettuce
description: A leafy green with multiple lobed leaves in a rosette, resembling a wild salad green sprouting from the earth.

name: Burdock Root
description: A thick, long root with rough brown skin, belonging to a tall plant topped with burr-like seed heads.

name: Horseradish Root
description: A coarse, knobby white root with a pungent aroma, typically found among damp woodlands.

name: Fiddlehead Fern
description: The tight young coiled frond of a fern, deep green and fuzzy, often found in moist forest undergrowth.

name: Reishi Mushroom
description: A kidney-shaped mushroom with a shiny red-brown surface and white edges, usually growing on fallen logs.

name: Reindeer Moss
description: A pale grayish-green lichen that forms dense carpet-like mats across cold, open ground.

name: Mountain Lichen
description: A crusty, dull-gray or greenish lichen that clings to rocky mountainsides and tree bark.

name: Wild Grape
description: Clusters of small round purple or green grapes hanging from twisting vines, with broad lobed leaves.

name: Sunberry
description: A rare golden-yellow berry that seems to softly gleam in strong daylight, found in open highland clearings.

name: Fey Apple
description: A strangely perfect apple with shimmering skin in hues of pink and gold, hanging on ancient trees in hidden groves.

name: Frostcap Mushroom
description: A tough, pale-white mushroom with a frosty sheen on its cap, found clinging to snowmelt streams in alpine areas.

name: Ghost Mushroom
description: A translucent, pale-white mushroom that gleams faintly in dim light, growing in secretive forest corners.

name: Snowberry
description: A cluster of small, round, frosty-white berries on a red-twigged shrub, often found in cold northern thickets.

name: Hawthorn Berry
description: Small round red berries that grow in clusters on thorny hawthorn bushes, common in hedgerows and woods.

name: Hickory Nut
description: A smooth, hard brown nut with a slightly square shape, often found inside green husks under tall hickory trees.

name: Pecan
description: An oblong, ridged brown nut often found in clusters beneath stately pecan trees.

name: Taro Stem
description: A thick, green stalk from an aquatic taro plant, with a bulbous joint and coarse texture.

name: Wild Rice
description: Long slender grains with a glossy dark husk, found sprouting from the tips of tall aquatic grass blades.

name: Barley Grain
description: A stalk of golden spiked grain with small tan kernels, waving gently in fields of wild barley.

name: Rosehip
description: A bright red or orange oval fruit, with a waxy sheen, found where wild roses have bloomed and withered.

name: Wild Cucumber
description: A small, green, spiky vine fruit that looks like a tiny cucumber, often found climbing on shrubs.

name: Ambrosia Melon
description: A perfectly round melon with a soft golden rind and faint floral scent, found in warm, open fields.

name: Stag nut
description: Hard-shelled nut showing a leaf-littered hue, found beneath shady boughs.

name: Fern cap
description: Gilled cap showing a dappled green hue, found at glade edges.

name: Moss pear
description: Plump pear showing a dappled green hue, found at glade edges.
